com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.collections

Class CollectionBasics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.collections.CollectionBasics

  • public class CollectionBasics
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides basic implementations for various methods used in collections

        Parameters:

        elements - to set to

      • containsAll

        public static boolean containsAll(java.util.Collection<?> collection,
                  java.util.Collection<?> elements)
        A basic containsAll implementation. (does not call collection.containsAll) Calls Collection.contains(Object) for all elements in the elements collection specified
        Parameters:
        collection - to look in
        elements - to look for
        Returns:
        True if all elements are contained, False if not

      • removeAll

        public static boolean removeAll(java.util.Collection<?> collection,
                java.util.Collection<?> elements)
        A basic removeAll implementation. (does not call collection.removeAll) Calls Collection.remove(Object) for all elements in the elements collection specified
        Parameters:
        collection - to remove from
        elements - to remove
        Returns:
        True if the collection changed, False if not

      • addAll

        public static <T> boolean addAll(java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                 java.util.Collection<? extends T> elements)
        A basic addAll implementation. (does not call collection.addAll) Calls Collection.add(Object) for all elements in the elements collection specified
        Parameters:
        collection - to add to
        elements - to add
        Returns:
        True if the collection changed, False if not

      • retainAll

        public static boolean retainAll(java.util.Collection<?> collection,
                java.util.Collection<?> elements)
        A basic retainAll implementation. (does not call collection.retainAll) After this call all elements not contained in elements are removed. Essentially all elements are removed except those contained in the elements Collection.
        Parameters:
        collection -
        elements - to retain
        Returns:
        True if the collection changed, False if not

      • toArray

        public static java.lang.Object[] toArray(java.util.Collection<?> collection)
        A basic toArray implementation. (does not call collection.toArray) A new array of Objects is allocated and filled with the contents of the collection
        Parameters:
        collection - to convert to an array
        Returns:
        a new Object[] array

      • toArray

        public static <T> T[] toArray(java.util.Collection<?> collection,
              T[] array)
        A basic toArray implementation. (does not call collection.toArray) If the array specified is not large enough, a new array with the right size is allocated. If the array specified is larger than the collection, the element right after the last collection element is set to null to indicate the end.
        Parameters:
        collection - to convert to an array
        array - to fill with the contents (can not be null)
        Returns:
        the array filled with the contents, or a new array of the same type

      • getEntry

        public static <T> CollectionBasics.ListEntry<T> getEntry(java.util.Collection<java.util.List<T>> lists,
                                         int index)
        Obtains a reference to an element in a collection of lists
        Parameters:
        lists - to pick from
        index - of the element
        Returns:
        list entry for the element at the index
